intro: Verticordia chrysostachys var. pallida, commonly known as the pale golden verticordia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, pendulous inflorescences. The plant produces small, golden-yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It prefers sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
